page.title: netUpb's Replacement Fleets Mod Text
page.descr: Text for the missions created by netUpb
page.t: Show stations with restricted docking permission in the list.
Marked stations will be ignored for ship production.
Player shipyards will be checked first for the production of destroyed ships.
NPC shipyards will be included for the production of destroyed ships.
Valid Updates for Ship Loadout Records
It updates the ship's changing 'equipments record' during equipment change or repair at a supply player station.
It updates the ship's changing 'equipments record' during equipment change or repair at a supply npc station.
It updates the ship's changing 'peoples record' during equipment change or repair at a supply player station.
It updates the ship's changing 'peoples record' during equipment change or repair at a supply npc station.
Reports the destroy information of {1134010, 500} ships on the Show Help popup window.
{1134010, 500}'s exploding ships and production result reports will be written in the logbook.
How long will it take for ships that failed to be produced to be attempted again automatically?
If approved, the production process of the new {1134010, 500} will automatically start after the {1134010, 500} cloning is done.
It creates the same %s ranks as in the {1134010, 500} record of the produced ship. If not selected, random low-level %s will be created.
Never rebuild ships which reduces player money below this amount.
Maximum price allowed for ship production. If the value requested for the ship's production fee at NPC stations exceeds this value, the ship will not be produced. To deactivate, set the value to 0.
If the game is opened in Debug Mode and the options here are activated;
Depending on the number of RFMs and the size of the Fleets, the screen may freeze until the logs are written to file.
Debug Mod. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.

It displays the changes on the fleet \(addition, removal, assigment change, explosion, undock, etc.\) in the debug text file. DebugChance must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
It displays the changes on the fleet lock status in the debug text file. DebugChance must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Enable debug files mode. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in '_RestockMain' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in '_RebuildCues' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_Fleets' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_FleetRecord' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_FleetRecord _tShipPlan' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_FleetRecord _tIndividualInstructions' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_FleetRecord _tBulkCrew' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_Command' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_RebuildCues' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_reBuild' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in 'RFM_xx_reAssignment' debugfile. Debug File Mode must be turned on. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
Detailed dump in '_BuildTaskIDs' debugfile. It is only effective when running the game with debug mod support.
When the ship belonging to this {1134010, 500} destroyed, the Rebuild process will be started automatically.
When the ship belonging to this {1134010, 500} destroyed, the Rebuild process will NOT be started automatically.
Removes the selected ship from the Replacement Fleet Records.\n ! Only valid for exploded ships that cannot be produced.
Are you sure you want to remove this?
Are you sure you want to remove this ship record?
Once confirmed, this option will appear again when the settings are reset to default.
Rebuild check timers are active. If it is turned off, Stops the rebuilding process of ships that have found a station among {1134010, 500} ships and are queued or have an active countdown timer.

Rebuild check timers are disabled. If turned on, The rebuild process is started for all ships within the {1134010, 500} whose production control has not started or has found a station and is queued or whose countdown timer is active.
Via lost ship replacement is used.
Whether to use the RFM tag on the rfm fleet commander name.
When checked, the 'Build' button takes action by Removing all problematic ware(s)\n
The ship's loadout record will NOT change.
Replace engine(s) from station's defined engines
If it is checked, when the 'Build' process is done, it selects a suitable engine(s) from the station's defined engines instead of incompatible engines.
This category shows all {1134010, 500} stations and ships.
Information about a selected object, including its name in the {1134010, 500} record, commander and subordinate information, and produce factions.
To monitor the situation after the re-production request for destroyed ships.
Observes crew information in the {1134010, 500} record of a selected object.
Observes loadout information in the {1134010, 500} record of a selected object.
Observes standing orders information in the {1134010, 500} record of a selected object.
The %s paintmod will be applied after production.
To fix, wait for the ship to be produced.
There is currently no functional build module for this ship \(this may be due to a conventional or hacking attack\). The build or upgrade could take longer than expected.
There is no compatible shipyard for construction.
No shipyard could be found that could produce this class.
No shipyard could be found that could produce this chassis.
The station located is in an unknown sector.
Couldnt find any station with shiptrader.
Wrong installed ware(s) for this station.
Can not select any possible Best Station in compability yards.
The calculated ship cost (%s Cr) exceeded the players available funds (%s Cr).
The calculated ship cost (%s Cr) exceeded the ship production allowed cost (%s Cr).
After the calculated ship fee (%s Cr) is deducted from the player\'s money, (%s Cr) the remaining amount is less than the set money threshold %s Cr.
There are ship(s) that cannot find a valid shipyard.
There are ship(s) that require manual Rebuild.

Commander has ordered replacement for ship from shipyard.
 Destroyed : $SHIP$
 Commander : $COMMANDER$
 Shipyard : $SHIPYARD$
 Sector : $SECTOR$

Commander failed to replace ship due to insufficient funds.. Waiting for Rebuild..
 Destroyed : $SHIP$
 Commander : $COMMANDER$
 Need Price : $PRICE$
 Player Money : $MONEY$
Commander failed to replace ship because can not Find any possible Best Shipyard.. Waiting for Rebuild..\n Destroyed : $SHIP$\n Commander : $COMMANDER$
Commander failed to replace ship because $STATUS$.. Waiting for Rebuild..\n Destroyed : $SHIP$\n Commander : $COMMANDER$

Commander has ordered rebuild ship but $STATUS$..
 Destroyed : $SHIP$
 Commander : $COMMANDER$
 Shipyard : $SHIPYARD$
 Sector : $SECTOR$
Commander failed to replace ship because $STATUS$.. \n Destroyed : $SHIP$\n Commander : $COMMANDER$

Since $COMMANDER$ has been closed, the ship under construction will be at the station where it was produced after production.
 Constructions : 
$SHIP$ Shipyard : $SHIPYARD$
 Sector : $SECTOR$
